{"step_by_step_thinking": "The provided documents are related to sickle cell anemia, a hereditary chronic hemolytic anaemia. The papers describe the characteristics of patients with homozygous SS and present their findings on red blood cell deformability, Hb F level, and other parameters. There is no mention of gene deletion, modification, point mutation, or frame shift mutation in the given documents. Therefore, based on the information provided, sickle cell anemia is not caused by any of these types of mutations.", "answer_choice": "C"}
